name: Walking Lounges
steps: Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Take a step forward with your right foot, and lower your body by bending your knees until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
Keep your back straight, your chest up, and your core engaged.
Push off your right foot and bring your left foot forward to meet your right foot.
Repeat the lunge by taking a step forward with your left foot, and bending your knees until your left thigh is parallel to the ground.
Keep alternating between your right and left legs, taking a step forward and lunging until you have completed the desired number of reps.
Make sure to keep your knee over your ankle, not over your toe, and avoid letting your knee go inward.
Remember to breathe in as you step forward and lunge, and breathe out as you push off your front foot.
comments: To make the exercise more challenging, you can hold weights in your hands or perform the lunges on an incline.
You can also mix it up by adding a twist to your torso or raising your arms over your head while lunging.
